intro: Matelea hemsleyana, commonly known as the Hemsley's morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many species of vines and herbs. The plant is characterized by its trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and violet. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a velvety texture, while its vines can climb or trail along the ground.
